definition: to show one's face/to appear (in public)
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to show your face in public (derog.)

sentences.english: Yarn-dyed Plaid cotton market began to turn up, but almost no turnover.
sentences.chinese: 色織格子棉布市場開始露面，但成交量幾乎沒有。

sentences.english: But some say the charts are slanted in favor of the stars who make the most small-screen appearances.
sentences.chinese: 而有人說排行榜十分青睞那些電視露面率很高的歌星。

sentences.english: It re-emerged briefly in 2005 but was then largely dormant.
sentences.chinese: 在2005年曾再次短暫露面，但隨機再次沉寂。

sentences.english: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.chinese: 在公開露面的場合，他也不刻意隱瞞他的博學多聞。

sentences.english: The little girl dares not to appear in public because she is cross - eyed .
sentences.chinese: 這個小女孩因爲斜視不敢在公共場合露面。

sentences.english: After disappearing for two years, the gangster surfaced in Thailand last month.
sentences.chinese: 在消聲匿跡兩年之後，那個流氓上個月在泰國露面了。

sentences.english: The president has started using look-alikes during some public appearances.
sentences.chinese: 這個總統開始用他的替身在許多公共場合露面。

sentences.english: Palin and McCain appeared together Wednesday at a rally in northern Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 佩林和麥凱恩星期三共同在北維州一個集會上露面。

sentences.english: During the fighting many of the soldiers took to the hills and were not seen until the war was over.
sentences.chinese: 在戰爭中有許多士兵開了小差，直到戰爭結束才露面。

sentences.english: Why had not that man appeared again?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼這個人不再露面了呢？

sentences.english: First, we have to suppose that she was out to make money.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我們得假定她拋頭露面是爲了賺錢。

sentences.english: He appeared on the ABC television broadcast This Week.
sentences.chinese: 迪恩這個星期在美國廣播公司的節目中露面。

sentences.english: I should be ashamed to show my face in public.
I riffed up an excuse as to why I didn't show up.
sentences.chinese: 我隨口編造了一個理由來解釋我爲什麼沒露面。

sentences.english: She appeared at the party but left quickly.
sentences.chinese: 她在聚會上露面，但很快就離開了。

sentences.english: But Mr. Sliva has not been seen in Toronto for some time.
sentences.chinese: 但斯里瓦先生已有一陣子沒在多倫多露面了。

definition: to show one's face/to make one's good name/to become successful and well known/to shine
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
very few/rarely
public/to publish/to make public
high-sounding speech/bombast/high-profile
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to see
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to meet/to see each other/CL:次[ci4]
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to let off/to give out
to transmit outwards/to disseminate/efferent (nerve)
recognition/to recognize
to combine/combination/composite character (i.e. a synonym of 合體字|合体字[he2 ti3 zi4])/(of clothes) to be a good fit
exception/to be an exception
